result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry L Cavins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit to DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.  Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid Rx. No entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores or where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol or where drug paraphernalia is purchased.  Any property seized during this investigation shall remain with Sheriff's Dept.  No contact with  T.H., M.O., C.M. and J.O.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Proceed to sentencing.

Plea to Count 1.  Count 2 dismiss/read in.    No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
36 months Probation
29 days Sauk County jail, with work release.  Jail to commence August 1, 2014 at 6:30 p.m.  No good time. 
DNA surcharge $250/sample ordered
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances and alcohol unless with valid Rx.  Use according to Rx.  Report Rx to agent within 2 working days.
Must submit Judgement of Conviction to attending physician for Rx purposes.  
Submit to random urinalysis, per agent.
No entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores or where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol or where drug paraphernalia purchased
Any property seized during this investigation remain with Sheriff's Dept.  
Obtain and maintain FT employment and or schooling
No contact with T.H., M.O., C.M. and  J.O.
AODA & treatment
$638.25 fine & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Count 2: Dismiss/read in
Felony admonishments.
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Jerry L Cavins in court with attorney Timothy C Henney.  John A Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of waiver today.  Attorney Henney agrees.  Proceed to sentencing today.  Court goes through waiver orally.  No written waiver filed.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Preliminary hearing on July 3, 2014 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Jerry L Cavins in court with attorney Timothy C Henney.  Linda A Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Henney states he needs to discuss some other matters w/ADA Newton.  Requests reset for either another RD or PH.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 09:45 am.
